message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "To assess the impact of natural disasters on poverty, we utilize data from the World Bank's Global Poverty Monitoring Database and the Emergency Events Database.", "dataset": ["Global Poverty Monitoring Database", "Emergency Events Database"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we examine the determinants of financial inclusion in Ethiopia using a nationally representative dataset from the Ethiopian Socioeconomic Survey (ESS) conducted by the Central Statistical Agency and the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Ethiopian Socioeconomic Survey (ESS)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between governance and economic growth across African countries using three datasets: the Worldwide Governance Indicators, the Africa Development Indicators, and the World Bank Enterprise Surveys.", "dataset": ["Worldwide Governance Indicators", "Africa Development Indicators", "World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Rural road construction programs in India have received considerable attention in recent years as part of the government's efforts to promote regional integration and economic development, and we use data from the Indian Human Development Survey to study their effects on social mobility.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey"], "topic": ["Regional Integration", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the impact of climate change policies on competitiveness, we use a combination of global macroeconomic models, firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys, and sector-level data from the IEA World Energy Balances.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "IEA World Energy Balances"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses a novel dataset of geo-referenced household surveys from both urban and rural areas in Cameroon to examine the determinants of food security and identify the most effective policy interventions.", "dataset": ["geo-referenced household surveys"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset of high-resolution satellite images coupled with household survey data from rural Ethiopia to investigate the impact of electrification on local economic activity and well-being.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite images", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the African Development Bank's Fragile States Index and the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys to investigate the relationship between fragility, conflict, and violence and firm performance in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["African Development Bank's Fragile States Index", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the effects of air pollution on health outcomes using data from the Demographic Health Survey and the Household Air Pollution Intervention Network Trial conducted in India.", "dataset": ["Demographic Health Survey", "Household Air Pollution Intervention Network Trial"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the long-term effects of early childhood nutrition on cognitive and non-cognitive skills, we use data from the Young Lives longitudinal study conducted in Ethiopia, India, Peru, and Vietnam.", "dataset": ["Young Lives longitudinal study"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}].
